page.title: 08The Quarry at Hingston Down
page.content: The{Hingston Down Quarry}is part of the national{A.R.C.Company.}There are {fifty two employees}in the quarry and {five office }workers.There are {nine {quarry workers}and{nine people working {the drills.}They only quarry{fine {grain granite,}but{in one week}they bring up{seven thousand tons}of grain granite. The actual quarry is three hundred metres by four hundred metres. The quarry area of{supply extends to{ Bodmin, Plymouth, {Okehampton, Exeter,}and{Penzance.}The quarry is expected to last another fifty to sixty years.The Parish Council bought the land off a farmer and the quarry leads from there.That was one hundred years ago.{Blasting takes place{two to four times a week.
